question: Question_03_(e)
statement:
Let $f(x) = \frac{\sin(x)}{e^{x}}$ on the interval $[0, \pi]$. In this
question you will sketch this function.

\textbf{(e)} Make a large sketch of the graph of $f$ below, including all
you have found in the previous parts of the question.
sols:
The function's value is zero at each end of the interval
\emph{{[}0,$\pi${]}}, we have found a maximum at \emph{$\pi$/4} and an
inflection point at \emph{$\pi$/2} so your sketch should look something like
the plotted function here.

\begin{description}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item[]
\includegraphics[width=.5\textwidth]{Math110Q3eApril2013.png}
\end{description}

Make sure you visibly identify the maximum and inflection point on your
sketch of the function.
hints:
Try incorporating the answers from parts a - d in order: first draw the
x-intercepts, then where the graph increases and decreases, and finally
adding the concavity.
